reference_a:
@article{hasselhorn2022,
  title = {The effects of assessment intensity on participant burden, compliance, within-person variance, and within-person relationships in ambulatory assessment},
  author = {Hasselhorn, Kilian and Ottenstein, Charlotte and Lischetzke, Tanja},
  date = {2022-08-01},
  journaltitle = {Behavior Research Methods},
  shortjournal = {Behav Res},
  volume = {54},
  number = {4},
  pages = {1541--1558},
  issn = {1554-3528},
  doi = {10.3758/s13428-021-01683-6}
}
topics: questionnaire length, affect, extraversion, perceived burden
additional_comments: no beep information available; study 2 of the cited paper; some variable coding unclear; original english codebook contains mixup of mood variables; also shared under https://osf.io/xt3rf/?view_only=6e6bf509c6374759b56faac680c55825

features.name: beep
features.coding: NA

features.name: week
features.coding: Week 1 or 2

features.name: well
features.coding:
How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very unwell
7 = very well
MDBF

features.coding:
How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very tired
7 = very awake
MDBF

7 = very relaxed

features.coding:
How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very unpleased

features.name: bold
features.coding:
How accurate does each adjective describe your behavior in the last half hour? Bold
1 = extremely inaccurate
5 = extremely accurate
Based on Mini-Markers for Big-Five

features.name: study_burden
features.coding:
How much of a burden was it to participate in the study today?
1 = not at all
5 = very much

features.name: study_interfere
features.coding:
How much did participating in the study interfere with your usual activities?
1 = not at all
5 = very much

features.name: study_annoy
features.coding:
How much were you annoyed with the number of times beeped per day?
1 = not at all
5 = very much
